CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ina Drayton, 2134 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of women bartenders?" answer reads: "I disapprove wholeheartedly, because I think that it is a man's job. I don't think that a woman should attend behind a bar."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ina Drayton, wearing trench coat with five ornate buttons, standing with eyes closed on Liberty Avenue with pedestrians and May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
